item.title: Sokcho, Gangwon, South Korea - Go catch Pokemon! Pokemon Go in Sokcho
item.description:
View from Sokcho Lighthouse Observatory

Go catch Pokemon! Pokemon Go in Sokcho

Sokcho, Gangwon, South Korea

In the summer of 2016, the Pokemon Go craze is not unusual. Pokemon Go is not yet officially released in Korea, but games are available in Sokcho, Gangwon-do and some surrounding areas. As this fact became known, Sokcho stood as 'Pokemon Holy Land'. Those who want to catch Pokemon flocked to Sokcho from all over the country. Sokcho buses were sold out, and a quick travel agency also offered travel packages to catch Pokemon. Let's take a look around playing Sokcho and Pokémon Go games that are screaming with the holiday season.
Sokcho, located between Goseong and Yangyang, Gangwon-do, has mountains, lakes, and sea as well as geographical advantages within two hours from the metropolitan area. Why don't you take a more meticulous trip to Sokcho with this Pokemon hunting? If you don't forget to lift your head to the reality behind the phone, it will be a trip to Pokémon holding Pokemon and Sokcho. Be careful about safety accidents.
Pokemon Go, are you?
In Pokemon Go, monsters appear in places where many people actually go. Since Pokemon is one of the most popular destinations, you need to know the local hotspots to meet many Pokemon. In the same vein, Sokcho's 11 most visited sites are the most popular tourist attractions of Sokcho. Among them are the Jangjang, where the bare-handed squid festival is in full swing.
I confess before I start catching a real monster. The reporter does not know the game. I've played Tetris games and have no interest in games or hobbies. The words augmented reality can only sound alien. I didn't understand why I was so enthusiastic that it was difficult to download the Pokemon Go app under the Korean account.
Augmented Reality Pokemon Go with 3D Graphics
Augmented Reality (AR) refers to a technology that displays computer-generated 3D graphics on a visible environment. In other words, if you run Pokemon Go, you will see the environment as if you were taking a picture, and monsters would appear on it. Then throw the monster ball to catch the Pokemon. Of course, it's not as easy as it sounds.
Augmented Reality Pokemon Go with 3D Graphics
Pokemon Go is a location-based game of Google Maps on your smartphone that requires monsters to enter a specific area. South Korea is missing here, but some survived and the Pokemon Go game was executed. That is Gangwon Sokcho and some surrounding areas. In addition to Sokcho, two other Pokemon Go viable areas, including Ulleung and Ulju-gun, Gyeongbuk are being discovered.
33-year-old office workers run from Seoul to Sokcho
Pokemon Go base camp, Sokcho, Expo Tower Park
In Sokcho, the sacred place of Pokemon, the center of Pokemon Go is Cheongcho Lake and Expo Tower Park. Wi-Fi maps and free smartphone charging are also available. Most of all, Pokémon seduces the hunters (?) So that you can take the Cheongcho Lake Expo Tower as a base camp and explore Abai Village, Sokcho Tourist Fish Market, Dongmyeong Port and Sokcho Beach.
Three generations of Pokemon Go
For us, Abai Village, famous for filming the drama "Autumn Fairy Tales", is a collective settlement of displaced people. Originally it was a place where few people lived, but when refugees gathered during the Korean War, a village was formed. There are many specialty shops where you can taste the Sunbuk style. Abai Village (Cheongho-dong) and Jungang-dong are located in a quiet place. Sokcho Tourist Fish Market, famous for Chicken Gangjeong and Alley of Chicken, is also considered a Pokemon hot spot. When you go to the market, take a good look around, and remember the meeting center in the basement of the fish market.
Abai Village where refugees were displaced during the Korean War
The next destination is the same name port. Let's go up to the lighthouse observatory that is Sokcho's proud view point. When the weather is good, you can see Sokcho city, as well as Sokcho Beach and Oeongchi Beach. Don't miss the Sokcho sea view from Yeonggeumjeong Observation Deck.
North Sokcho Port Details
If you go north from Dongmyeong Port, it is a Jangjeo, and if you go south, Sokcho Beach. First, let's go to the market where the squid man-handed festival is held until July 31. Squid fishing is in full swing along the small beach. Enjoy a short walk to the lighthouse with Pokemon.
genus
Sokcho Beach is now. You can enjoy exciting bathing on the fine sandy beach. Here, too, face those who came to catch Pokemon.
Young people from Busan to play Pokemon Go
The seven-year-old kid from Seoul was more engaged in games than swimming. Young people from Seoul and Busan were also busy catching monsters.
7 year old kid from Seoul
If you are uncomfortable with Sokcho Beach, head to Oeongchi Beach.
Sokcho beach view
In both directions, so if you keep the sea on your left and go down, you will reach outland. You can enjoy swimming in a relatively quiet sea.
Sokcho beach view
If you stop at Daepo Port, you will see all the monsters on the coast. Now let's go to Seoraksan.
Road to Mt. Geumseong by Seoraksan Cable Car
Seoraksan is known as an unexpected Pokemon Haunting Area. It is often called Seorak in Sokcho area, and it is enough to take a cable car to look at Kwon Geumseong and look at Sinheungsa, an obscene music inspector. Shinheungsa was founded in 652 by the ruler named Hyangseongsa.
Seoraksan Sinheungsa Temple

Throughout the wait for the cable car, people were busy catching Pokemon. I could not see the face of Mt. Sorak in the thick fog, but it was obvious that it was a different experience. Rumors that there is a Pokemon in Everest will not be rumored. Some even go out of the boat to catch rare Pokemon. In all cases, don't forget it's a safety first. Pokemon Go's completion is a safe return.

Due to the Pokemon Go craze, Sokcho City began providing the integrated Pokemon Go online map on the City Hall website (www.sokcho.gangwon.kr) on July 26th. The integrated map, based on Google Maps, shows 8 locations of Sokcho tours, including the location of the `` Pocket Stop '' charging station, Pokemon training and combat space `` Pokemon Go Gymnasium '', and a free battery charging station. If you have a Pokemon Go hunting plan, you should check the benefits to the game users. If you catch 30 Pokémon by August 8, you can visit Sokcho City Museum for free.

Soraksan Cable Car
